intro: Blepharodon grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often with a white throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile addition to rock gardens and alpine landscapes.
